Spain: Aurelius died. He was succeeded by his cousin-in-law, Silo of Asturias, husband of Alfonso the Catholic's daughter Adosinda. Silo established his capital at Pravia.
Italy: Charlemagne is crowned in Pavia and becomes King of the Lombards.
Germany: Siege of Pavia (773–74): Desiderius opened the gates of Pavia and surrendered to Charlemagne.
Charlemagne was crowned with the Iron Crown of Lombardy king of the Lombards at Pavia.
France: Following successful conquests, Charlemagne became king of the Lombards.
